metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1424 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
apparmor_parser in the apparmor package before 2.8.95~2430-0ubuntu5.1 in Ubuntu 14.04 allows attackers to bypass AppArmor policies via unspecified vectors, related to a "miscompilation flaw."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1424` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apparmor - 2.8.95~2430-0ubuntu5.1
apparmor-easyprof - 2.8.95~2430-0ubuntu5.1
apparmor-notify - 2.8.95~2430-0ubuntu5.1
apparmor-profiles - 2.8.95~2430-0ubuntu5.1
apparmor-utils - 2.8.95~2430-0ubuntu5.1
dh-apparmor - 2.8.95~2430-0ubuntu5.1
libapache2-mod-apparmor - 2.8.95~2430-0ubuntu5.1
libapparmor-perl - 2.8.95~2430-0ubuntu5.1
libapparmor1 - 2.8.95~2430-0ubuntu5.1
libpam-apparmor - 2.8.95~2430-0ubuntu5.1
python-apparmor - 2.8.95~2430-0ubuntu5.1
python-libapparmor - 2.8.95~2430-0ubuntu5.1
python3-apparmor - 2.8.95~2430-0ubuntu5.1
python3-libapparmor - 2.8.95~2430-0ubuntu5.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> caused by incomplete backport in trusty tyhicks> Ptrace, mount, and possibly other rule types are affected Issue was specific to Ubuntu. The final version of the patch that was committed upstream was not vulnerable.

criterions.comment: apparmor package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.8.95~2430-0ubuntu5.1').
